name: stuffed squid
ingredients: For the stuffing: 75 g of quinoa (or rice/vermicelli), 110 ml of vegetable broth, 300 g of raw shrimp (peeled and chopped), 2 tablespoons of green olives (pitted and chopped), 2 tablespoons of yellow bell pepper (diced), 2 tablespoons of red bell pepper (diced), 1 clove of garlic (chopped), 2 tablespoons of parsley (chopped), 2 tablespoons of coriander (chopped), 1 teaspoon of ground cumin, 2 teaspoons of paprika, 1/2 teaspoon of salt

For the tomato sauce: 700 g of peeled tomatoes, 1 teaspoon of ground coriander, 1 teaspoon of ground cumin, 1 teaspoon of paprika, 2 bay leaves, 1 clove of garlic (crushed), 1 tablespoon of tomato paste, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 red bell pepper (optional)
steps: Prepare the stuffing: Cook the quinoa in the vegetable broth (15 minutes cooking, 10 minutes resting). Mix the cooked quinoa with the chopped shrimp, olives, bell peppers, garlic, parsley, coriander, cumin, and paprika. Season to taste.
Fill the squid tubes with the stuffing (leave a 1.5 cm space at the top). Close the end with a toothpick.
Prepare the tomato sauce: Saut√© the red bell pepper in olive oil (if used). Add the diced tomatoes, bay leaves, garlic, tomato paste, coriander, cumin, and paprika. Let it simmer.
Add 150 ml of hot water to the tomato sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat.
Place the stuffed squids in the sauce. Cover and cook for 45 minutes, turning the squids after 25 minutes.
